LEGITIMATELY_SKIPPED.reason: Adding monitoring for latency, failure rates, and token usage requires an external monitoring/observability service infrastructure (e.g., Datadog, Prometheus). Cannot be meaningfully added without such infrastructure in place.

DESIGN_DECISION.reason: The exportPDF function accepts options as a flat parameter object which is a standard API pattern. These are consumed by the calling UI component which decides what to expose. Progressive disclosure is a UI concern, not an API concern. The internal API grouping is appropriate.

Grouping all tool activity types (audit, accessibility, imagealt, meta, schema, readability) under a single 'Tools' filter category is an intentional design decision to keep the filter bar manageable. Splitting into individual tool filters would create too many options.

The HomePage serves as a comprehensive dashboard showing stats, quick actions, tools, recent projects/audits, favorites, activity, and recommendations. This density is an intentional design choice for a dashboard landing page providing at-a-glance access to all features.

Quick Actions (compact icon buttons at top) and Content Tools (full card grid with descriptions and stats) serve different UX purposes. Quick Actions provide fast one-click navigation while Content Tools provide discovery and context. Intentional redundancy for different user needs.
